item.title: Manmohan Singh death: As mark of respect, Congress cancels all programmes for next seven days - The Hindu
item.description:
Congress Cancels Programs for a Week in Honor of Manmohan Singh

Publication Date: December 27, 2024, Source: The Hindu

The Congress party has announced the cancellation of all official programmes for the next seven days in memory of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, who passed away at the age of 92.

  • Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh died at AIIMS, New Delhi.
  • The Congress has cancelled its foundation day celebrations and all other official events.
  • Congress flag will be flown at half-mast during this mourning period.
  • Party activities are set to resume on January 3, 2025.
  • Singh's death was announced at the conclusion of a Congress Working Committee meeting in Belagavi, Karnataka.
“Party programmes will resume on 3rd January 2025,” said K C Venugopal.

The Congress party is in a period of mourning as they honor the legacy of Dr. Manmohan Singh, who was instrumental in India’s economic reforms.

item.title: Union Budget 2025: Modi govt mulls cutting income tax for individuals earning upto Rs 15 lakhs per annum - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Union Budget 2025: Modi govt mulls cutting income tax for individuals earning upto Rs 15 lakhs per annum

Published on: 26 December 2024, 15:20 IST

The Narendra Modi government is evaluating a proposal to reduce income tax for individuals earning up to Rs 15 lakhs per annum in the upcoming budget to alleviate the financial burden on the middle class amid a slowing economy.

  • The tax cut could potentially benefit many taxpayers, especially in urban areas with high living costs.
  • Indian taxpayers currently have the option between two tax systems: a legacy plan with exemptions and a newer, less complicated system introduced in 2020.
  • No definitive decision has been made on the size of the tax cuts; considerations will continue until the union budget announcement on February 1.
  • The reduction in taxes may encourage more people to choose the newer tax system.
  • The middle class is facing political pressure due to high taxes alongside slow wage growth and rising inflation.
“More money in the hands of the middle class might help rev up the economy, the world's fifth biggest.”

He emphasizes the need to understand RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's comments in full context, especially given the historical demand for the temples since 1984.

  • The VHP argues that if the temples of Kashi and Mathura were under Hindu control, many disputes would not occur.
  • Parande asserts Bhagwat's comments were misinterpreted and need to be understood contextually.
  • Recent editorial controversies within RSS's own publications reflect differing views on temple-mosque disputes.
  • The ongoing discourse touches on the historical context of religious sites and the quest for civilizational justice.
“His statement must be looked at in full context and not in isolation.” - Milind Parande

The VHP's statements underscore the continuing complexity of religious disputes in India, highlighting the ongoing quest for recognition and justice within the broader socio-political landscape.

  • Five-judge benches were established multiple times to manage the impact of these comments.

The year marked a continual struggle for the judiciary to maintain integrity and public trust amid rising tensions and controversial statements.

item.title: Budget 2025: India eyes income tax relief for middle class earning up to ₹15 lakh, check details - Mint
item.description:
Budget 2025: India eyes income tax relief for middle class earning up to ₹15 lakh

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Reuters

India is looking at reducing income tax for individuals earning up to 1.5 million rupees ($17,590) per year to provide relief to the middle class and support the economy as growth slows. The proposal, if enacted, could benefit millions and support city dwellers facing rising living costs.

  • The income tax cuts are aimed at middle-class taxpayers.
  • The current tax systems offer exemptions or lower rates with varying complexity.
  • Further decisions on the size of tax cuts will be made closer to the budget date, February 1.
  • The middle class has expressed concerns over high taxation relative to slow wage growth and inflation.
  • Reducing tax rates could encourage more people to opt for a simpler tax system.
“More money in the hands of the middle class might help rev up the economy.”

The anticipated tax cuts could provide necessary relief to millions and stimulate demand amid rising living costs and inflation pressures.
